column4: hi all. is there any way to figure out what file was deleted from this dmesg output: EXT4-fs (sda9): ext4_orphan_cleanup: deleting unreferenced inode 1446701
Check the /lost+found folder at the root of this filesystem.
Okay, then this probably isn't a problem unless you have obviously filesystem corruption elsewhere.
well some files are defo missing... I have a svn folder that used to be fine before this but now "svn st" says that it is not a working copy
umount the filesystem and force an offline check.
but I was just trying to figure out what other files have been lost, there are 22 in total entries for  ext4_orphan_cleanup
but it has already checked and fixed the "problem" by deleting the inodes... i just want to figure out what inodes it has deleted
Did you write down the inode numbers?
or more to the point, i want to know if it is possible to know what inodes have been deleted (i.e. what position in the file system ) from the id number
yes i have them all in dmesg log
Deep voodoo.  First, take the system offline and make a 1-to-1 copy of the disk.  Second, you'll need to read about the e2fs progs.
or are you talking about other tools ?
After you have a raw copy of the broken filesystem,  poke some of the inodes using the debugfs program.
This is not an easy fix.  Learning how to back out an inode problem will be hours of reading and learning.  Just restore from backup if you have a critical problem.
you see that is the problem... everything is working fine! I have only noticed 2 problems with the file system, i.e. stuff missing, and i'm worried about *where* the other 22 missing inodes are from
i don't actually have a "critical probelm" i'm just "critically worried" ...
Then you answered your question...  Restore the system from backup.
